entry.title: Can’t Do A Thing (To Stop Me)
entry.summary:
Author: estrelittaz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,201Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: There was no time or place for damage control. And he kept wondering if maybe that was a test or a curse, perhaps even a vicious circle. Making him pay for every wrong doing he ever did whilst becoming who he is now. Yet, maybe, just maybe the people closest to him would start questioning his disappearance. Perhaps he was in need of someone saving him. Or at least waiting for someone to drag him out of his misery.

entry.title: How did two broke journalists wind up with the famously unattainable bachelor billionaires?
entry.summary:
Author: tearsofjoyandsorrow

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,897Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 15

Summary: What if there were a universe where DC and Marvel were intermixed and we got to see the insane similarities of superbat and starker?In this universe, it just so happens that the Daily Bugle and the Daily Planet are sister companies working out of New York and Metropolis, respectively, and every once and a while, there are larger crossover events in which Peter Parker and Clark Kent interact. They aren't best friends by any means, but they get along quite well.Simultaneously, Bruce Wayne and Tony Stark are maintaining a strange frenemies dynamic. When the world looks like it's going to end, the two of them band together to resolve things, but outside of that, they frequently try to one-up each other with their tech, bank accounts and sexual conquests.I'm still not sure what I am doing, but someone said they would read this, so here I try!

entry.title: Solar Eclipse
entry.summary:
Author: obelisque

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,485Chapters: 6/15Kudos: 590

Summary: “You’re a lot better than the last billionaire I met,” Kent remarked, leaning back. His confidence had indeed transformed him. “How so?” Kent uttered a strangled laugh. “Well, he trained monkeys to spam hate comments about me online, kidnapped my dog—well the custody situation over him is, uh, up in the air right now, but still—and locked me up in a pocket dimension to be tortured to death.” Bruce blinked. "...Interesting," he said.- After an interview gone awry, Clark Kent and Bruce Wayne both leave with the knowledge of each other's secret identities. But what starts as a perceived weakness soon reveals itself to be an unexpected strength as the two men begin to recognize their compatibility in battle, intelligence, and most importantly, matters of the heart.

entry.title: A Kryptonian and His Gladiator
entry.summary:
Author: Eyeslikedawn

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,434Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 10

Summary: Kryptonian society on the conquered planet Earth is complicated to say the least. When Lord Kal-El's house-guard is slain he decides to rebuild his ranks by purchasing a prized gladiator from Gotham City. His name is Bruce Wayne but the fans of the arena know him as Batman. Regardless what they call him, though, with the human's stoic demeanor, and grim attitude, Kal has certainly bought more than he bargained for.

entry.title: Power
entry.summary:
Author: ope-uh-oh (shortjacketlongskirt)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 34,570Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 56

Summary: There were rumours all over Gotham of the ‘prince’ crashing out. There were pictures of Bruce Wayne in the news in which he was waving away the paparazzi as he walked out of a drug store carrying an armful of painkillers at three in the morning; wandering around in Crime Alley with a dime bag and a half-empty bottle of whiskey more expensive than most people could even dream about—and that same image came up in the news next to one of him in a gurney, bruises all over his face and body, unconscious. Some people thought it was understandable, considering one of his adopted kids had just gone missing. Others thought it was a disgrace for a man to be acting like this when the police were doing everything in their power to bring the kid back... Everything in the world is about sex, except sex. Sex is about power. After Jason died, Bruce was a wreck. He went off the deep end, succumbing to vices he'd never touched before. He lost himself in decisions he hoped he could leave in his past, but they're catching up faster than he's willing to meet them

entry.title: the story that writes itself
entry.summary:
Author: oceanrayes

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,655Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 42

Summary: Clark’s eyes are boring into the side of his skull, so he gives him a quick glance and a raised brow. “I didn’t get your name,” Clark says. The only reason why Bruce actually believes him is because of how earnestly he speaks. Not to sound full of himself, but you’d have to be living under a rock to not know who Bruce is after four years on this campus. Maybe it’s a blessing in disguise. No preconceived notions, no expectations. For the first time since his parents died, Bruce is on even footing with a stranger; Bruce knows the same amount of information about Clark that Clark does about him—nothing. “It’s Bruce,” he says. Clark leans back in his seat, arms crossed over his chest, satisfied. “Good to meet you, Bruce.” Or: Bruce Wayne meets Clark Kent in a photojournalism class. The story practically writes itself.
